info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 4:23AM CDT until June 12 at 7:15AM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following county, Harris.
* WHEN...Until 715 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 423 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2.6 inches of rain have fallen at HCFCD gauges between the Beltway and East Loop in the past hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northwestern Pasadena, Deer Park, Galena Park, Jacinto City, Channelview, Cloverleaf, Highlands, Barrett, Crosby, Sheldon, Houston Ship Channel, Hunterwood, Northshore, El Dorado / Oates Prairie, East Houston, Clinton Park Tri-Community, Harrisburg / Manchester, Meadowbrook / Allendale and Lake Houston. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM CDT THIS MORNING
